title: Onsite Rentals IPO priced at up to 9.6-times cash profit
text:
Terms are out for national equipment rental company Onsite Rentals' initial public offering.

The company will seek to raise up to $253 million at 8.9-times to 9.6-times forecast cash profit, according to terms sent to funds on Tuesday morning.

The deal was priced at $2.87 to $3.15 a share with a bookbuild scheduled to open on October 28 to determine the final price.

The price represented 4.9-times to 5.2-times forecast 2020 financial year EBITDA and 8.9-times to 9.6-times cash earnings. It was also 12.8-times to 13.7-times on a price-to-earnings basis, using accounting earnings.

It valued Onsite Rentals at $400 million to $430 million on a market capitalisation basis and $490 million to $520 million in terms of enterprise value.

It also implied a 4.4 per cent to 4.7 per cent dividend yield.
description: Terms are out for national equipment rental company Onsite Rentals' initial public offering.
